recipeIngredient: 2 cups packed fresh chopped mint leaves  (or 2 bunches)
2 cups packed fresh chopped cilantro (I use leaves and stems or 2 bunches)
1  hot green chili (use less or more for preferred spice level)
1 teaspoon cumin powder or cumin seeds
1 Tablespoon lemon juice or to taste
1/4 teaspoon kala namak  (ndian black salt or use more lemon juice to taste)
1/2  a medium sized apple chopped (or use tomato or omit)
non dairy butter or extra virgin olive oil

recipeInstructions.text: Blend all the ingredients into a smooth thick paste. Use a few Tablespoons of water if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend all the ingredients into a smooth thick paste. Use a few Tablespoons of water if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Taste and Adjust salt and spice, mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Taste and Adjust salt and spice, mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Keep in an air tight container in the refrigerator for a few days or freeze for months. Thaw when needed and use.
recipeInstructions.name: Keep in an air tight container in the refrigerator for a few days or freeze for months. Thaw when needed and use.

recipeInstructions.text: Top a slice of bread with the mint chutney. Spread evenly.
recipeInstructions.name: Top a slice of bread with the mint chutney. Spread evenly.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle salt and pepper to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle salt and pepper to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread earth balance or other non dairy butter on the top slice and place on the sandwich.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread earth balance or other non dairy butter on the top slice and place on the sandwich.

recipeInstructions.text: Slice diagonally or in any other shape as preferred.
